node.title: Drug Company Settles with N.Y. for $200 Million in Sprawling Opioid Case
node.description: The agreement with Allergan, a company whose best-known product is Botox, is the latest settlement in the case jointly argued by New York State and two counties.

node.title: Josh Duggar Is Convicted of Downloading Child Sexual Abuse Imagery
node.description: Mr. Duggar, who gained celebrity on the TLC reality show “19 Kids and Counting,” faces a maximum penalty of 40 years in prison and $500,000 in fines.

node.title: Beautiful Photos Show Comet Leonard Passing Earth Before It Vanishes for 80,000 Years
node.description: The comet has been spotted flying through the night this month after it was discovered in January 2021.

node.title: IOC President Thomas Bach Says Media Should 'Respect' Peng Shuai's Wish for Privacy
node.description: "Why don't you respect Peng Shuai in this and let her decide where her priorities are," President of the International Olympic Committee Thomas Bach said.

node.title: 22 Journalists Killed in Philippines Since Rodrigo Duterte Became President
node.description: Jesus "Jess" Malabanan, 58, died after being shot in the head in the city of Calbayog in Samar province, as he watched television in his family stall.

node.title: 30-Year-Old With COVID Loses Arms, Legs After Being Given Choice to Amputate Limbs or Die
node.description: Candice Davis is now encouraging people to get vaccinated against the disease.

node.title: California Requiring Residents to Recycle Food Waste, Plans to Convert Into Energy Source
node.description: The state passed a law mandating Californians to put their food waste in a separate bin so it can be composted or turned into biogas, an energy source.

node.title: Letitia James Suspends NY Governor Bid to 'Finish Important Investigations' as AG
node.description: Instead, James announced she will run for re-election as New York attorney general in 2023.

node.title: FDA Authorizes Pfizer Booster Shots for 16- and 17-Year-Olds, CDC Will Have Final Say
node.description: This potential advancement comes as 5 million children ages 5 to 11 are expected to be at least partially vaccinated by the end of the week.

node.title: Arizona Coyotes Days Away from Eviction at Home Arena Over $1.3M in Unpaid Bills
node.description: The hockey team owes $1.3 million from "unfortunate human error" to the city of Glendale and the arena's management company.

node.title: Lawyer in Oxford Shooting Lawsuit Says School Officials Could Have Prevented 'Slaughter'
node.description: An attorney for survivors of the recent shooting said school administrators and teachers violated students' civil rights by not protecting them.

node.title: Woman in Santa Hat Sings Anti-Covid Restrictions Christmas Parody at Local Govt. Meeting
node.description: "I don't care about the variants because of natural immunity," sang the woman during a recent San Diego County Board of Supervisors meeting.

node.title: Covid-19: Active case numbers inflated with recovered people
node.description: Thousands of people who have recovered from Covid-19 are still being counted as active cases because updating data is an "administrative burden" on public health units.

node.title: U.K. reimposes COVID rules amid claims government itself ignored them
node.description: Scandal over an apparent party at PM Boris Johnson's own house, of which he denies any knowledge, shakes trust in the government as the U.K. grapples with rising Omicron cases.

node.title: Josh Duggar guilty in child pornography trial
node.description: The former reality star, who appeared on "19 Kids and Counting" with his family, is charged with two counts of downloading and possessing child pornography.

node.title: Oklahoma executes 79-year-old man for 1985 killing of teacher
node.description: Bigler Stouffer II was the first person executed in Oklahoma since John Grant convulsed on the gurney and vomited during his lethal injection in October as the state ended a six-year execution moratorium.

node.title: Why the PS5 is still hard to find — and tips for scoring one
node.description: Blame supply-chain disruption and bots for the shortage. "It's like playing the lottery at this point," one expert says.

node.title: ‘Red Rocket’ Review: All My XXX’s Live in Texas
node.description: A porn star returns to his hometown in Sean Baker’s latest slice of hard-luck Americana.

node.title: Giving Gifts? No Way! Yes, of Course!
node.description: Holiday gift giving, pro and con (yes, really!). Also: Taxpayers and religious schools; the schmear shortage; a chassis maker’s view.

node.title: Bob Iger, soon to leave Disney, returns to his weatherman roots.
node.description: Mr. Iger, who will retire on Dec. 31, stood in on Thursday for the usual weather guru on KABC in Los Angeles.

node.title: Dole is lying in state at the Capitol, returning to the building where he served for decades.
node.description: President Biden spoke at the tribute, but there will be no public viewing because of the pandemic.

node.title: Instagram 'Playback': Meta Launches Own Version of Yearly Review
node.description: Instagram has just launched a new roundup feature that lets you go through your Stories archive. Here's everything you need to know about Instagram Playback 2021.

node.title: Reddit Launches Its Own Version of Spotify Wrapped With Personalized Annual Review Feature
node.description: Reddit has just launched its own equivalent of Spotify Wrapped. With this feature, you can learn where you fitted in relation to the biggest trends of the year.

node.title: Jefferson Memorial Gets Cleaned, Repaired as Part of Massive National Park Funding Effort
node.description: The Great American Outdoor Act is giving necessary funds for maintenance and repairs to national parks such as the Jefferson Memorial.

node.title: Josh Duggar Convicted in Child Pornography Case, Faces 20 Years in Prison
node.description: Duggar and his extensive family were formerly featured in the TLC series "19 Kids and Counting."

node.title: Tesla Software Allowing Drivers to Play Video Games While Car is Moving Under Scrutiny
node.description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration confirmed Wednesday that it had begun an inquiry and was in conversation with Tesla about the feature.

node.title: Man Finds Terrified Ginger Cat Hiding in Closet After Owner 'Moved Out'
node.description: "I know there's a lot of hate comments, there's nothing else I could have done for this cat," the real-estate investor said.

node.title: Redditor Shares Major Vacuum-Sealed Packing Fail in Viral Post
node.description: "It took me hours to properly fold everything and seal it all and I spent like $20 on the bags," the Redditor explained.

node.title: Council agrees with iwi over discouraging summer visitors to eastern Bay of Plenty
node.description: Ōpōtiki District Council is backing calls from iwi leaders to restrict movement into the region to help keep Covid-19 from spreading into the rohe.

node.title: Whakaari eruption two years on: Iwi shares karakia in memory of victims
node.description: The Whakatāne community is gathering for a special ceremony to mark two years since the Whakaari / White Island eruption.
